background: A firm produces multiple goods using different raw materials. Each good requires certain amounts of the raw materials and generates specific revenue.
constraints: The quantity of raw material i used cannot exceed Available amount
objective: Maximize the firm's total revenue from goods production
description: A firm produces \param{M} different goods using \param{N} different raw materials. The firm has \param{Available} amount of raw material i available. Good j requires \param{Requirements} units of material i per unit produced. Good j results in a revenue of \param{Prices} per unit produced. How much of each good should the firm produce in order to maximize its total revenue?

parameters.definition: Number of different goods produced by the firm
Number of different raw materials used by the firm
Available amount of each raw material
Requirement of material j for producing one unit of good i
Revenue earned from selling one unit of good j
